blog.name: bringbackgenisvellandphylavell
blog.title: Bring back Genis and Phyla Vell
blog.description:
Site dedicated to all things Genis-Vell and Phyla-Vell. Former Captains Marvel and son and daughter of the original one, Mar-Vell. They were killed off very soon by Marvel and they deserve a second chance, we don't ask about a new chance as Captains Marvel but to come back to the Cosmic Marvel Universe (Quasar, Photon, Legacy, Martyr, whatever). 

Posts about Genis and Phyla. Mar-Vell, Rick Jones, Guardians of the Galaxy, Adam Warlock, Quasar, Thanos, Starlin stuff, some Avengers and a lot of Cosmic stuff. Welcome!

summary: Namor's Bloody War And the Strongest Issue Yet: Avengers #9
title: Namor's Bloody War And the Strongest Issue Yet: Avengers #9
body:
Namor’s Bloody War And the Strongest Issue Yet: Avengers #9

Tiger Shark attacks a cruise liner off the coast of the Bahamas, but he finds it defended by aquatic armored hero, Stingray. The two fight in the ocean but are interrupted by Namor, the Sub-Mariner and Emperor of Atlantis. He issues an ultimatum to both men to join him or stay out of the ocean. Stingray denies it. We then jump back a few days as the Avengers ride out into the ocean to have a…

View On WordPress

title: ScarJo is pulling in the $$!
body:
Firstly yay BW movie. Obvs. 

Secondly, $$. And last I read, ScarJo is the highest paid actress in the WORLD. 

THIS IS WHAT HAPPENS WHEN WOMEN GET AWESOME ROLES

🕷️ I, for one, cannot wait to see this movie  🕷️

For now, I’m excited about Captain Marvel

But BW is always right up there, always 

YAY

blog.name: frootforthought
blog.title: Listen To Me Ramble About Stuff
blog.description: Hi! I've been on here for ~4 years and only now am I going to start interacting with everyone! Call me Froot.

body:
Avengers 4′s Possible Title???

Hey guys

I’ve been giving this topic some thought, and after all that has been revealed and debunked, I kinda came to an odd conclusion that sort of fits:

Avengers: Nemesis

Why Nemesis? First of all, Nemesis is actually the name of a badass space lady that, when combined with seven (7) infinity stones and two powerful entities, can literally kill all of the Avengers if she wanted to. And I’m pretty sure she did in the comics.

But Froot! I hear you shout. There are only 6 infinity stones!

Well, according to her bio, Nemesis is comprised of the Time, Space, Reality, Power, Soul, Mind, and Ego stones as well as two powerful entities. Where have we heard that name before?

I know, I know. Ego is dead, but that doesn’t mean there isn’t a carcass for someone in space to find.

And those two powerful entities? They were none other than Loki and some alien chick named Sersi. Well, since the idea of the Eternals haven’t really been introduced, they might replace Sersi with Wanda, since she’s also a powerful entity in the MCU. It would explain why Loki has been kept alive, and why he is supposedly a key to the future plans of Avengers 4.

I don’t know if the Russo brothers are planning to bring Nemesis into the MCU as she is just yet, but it would be a cool idea to play with. I can’t wait for the movie to come out!

Read more on Nemesis here and here!

summary: Show Notes for #1: Against My Best Advice Some things we discussed in this episode: Are the Kree blue or Caucasian? Are Mar-Vell...
body:
Show Notes for #1: Against My Best Advice

Some things we discussed in this episode:

Are the Kree blue or Caucasian?

Are Mar-Vell and Una a couple?

Yon-Rogg’s very unclear end game

Mar-Vell: hero of one small part of Florida (not Earth)

Carol is kind of progressive but no one else in the comic thinks so:

Mar-Vell tricks his way into Cape Canaveral

Is the green and blue costume Carol wears in the movie supposed to be the same as Mar-Vell’s ugly green and white costume?

Mar-Vell’s costume reminds Chris of the original Saturn Girl’s costume. (See here: https://www.writeups.org/saturn-girl-legion-super-heroes-silver-age/)

Walter Lawson/Mar-Vell gaslights Carol without hesitation:

Clothes for comic book women!

Mar-Vell is lawful neutral, at least at first.

All the romances lack agency!

Is Mar-Vell into Carol? We can’t tell!

Carol thinks Mar-Vell has better superpowers than he actually has!

Rachael is curious: What makes Mar-Vell popular?

Rachael spoils 1980s comics (SORRY)

Chris asks Rachael about modern Carol comics and she lovingly talks about Ms. Marvel #28 (the 2016 version) and also complains about Civil War II.

We discuss how every writer does things a little differently.

Also: BUTTS:

NEXT TIME: More Captain Marvel, but we’ll stop before we get to the explosion that gives Carol her powers.
